title: Ivar Formo
text:
Ivar Formo (24 June 1951 – 26 December 2006) was a <a href="Norway">Norwegian</a> <a href="cross-country%20skiing%20%28sport%29">cross-country skier</a> and <a href="orienteering">orienteer</a> who competed during the 1970s.
Career.
He won four medals at the <a href="Winter%20Olympics">Winter Olympics</a>. Formo also won two bronze medals at the <a href="FIS%20Nordic%20World%20Ski%20Championships">FIS Nordic World Ski Championships</a> in the 4 × 10 km relay (<a href="1974%20FIS%20Nordic%20World%20Ski%20Championships">1974</a>, <a href="1978%20FIS%20Nordic%20World%20Ski%20Championships">1978</a>). Formo also competed in <a href="orienteering">orienteering</a>, winning a bronze medal in the relay at the 1974 <a href="1974%20World%20Orienteering%20Championships">world championships</a>, where he also placed ninth in the individual contest.
He represented the club <a href="SFK%20Lyn">SFK Lyn</a>. He won a number of awards for his accomplishments within sports, notably the <a href="Holmenkollen%20medal">Holmenkollen medal</a> in 1975 (shared with <a href="Gerhard%20Grimmer">Gerhard Grimmer</a> and his good friend and rival <a href="Oddvar%20Br%C3%A5">Oddvar Brå</a>) and <a href="Egebergs%20%C3%86respris">Egebergs Ærespris</a> in 1973.
In 1979 he was part of the Lyn <a href="Jukola%20relay">Jukola orienteering relay</a> winning team.
After retiring as an athlete he had a successful career as a businessman, and served as chairman of the cross-country committee (1983–1988) in the <a href="International%20Ski%20Federation">International Ski Federation</a>. Formo earned an engineering degree, and was chairman of the board of Ignis at the time of his death.
Formo was found drowned in the lake <a href="Store%20Sandungen">Store Sandungen</a> in <a href="Nordmarka">Nordmarka</a>, the forests surrounding <a href="Oslo">Oslo</a>. He had gone jogging and skating through the area and had most likely fallen through the ice. He was survived by his two sons, and his partner during fifteen years, former orienteering competitor <a href="Wenche%20Jacobsen">Wenche Jacobsen</a>.
Cross-country skiing results.
All results are sourced from the <a href="International%20Ski%20Federation">International Ski Federation (FIS)</a>.
